  • Help

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ActionChoiceMessage
This Message is used to communicate the player's choice (Character Card or student movement) during an Action Phase of an Expert mode match.
ANSIConstants
This class contains the ANSI constants representing the colors and the font types used by the CLI.
ArrayListStringCard
Defines a generic Character Card that needs an ArrayList of String as a parameter.
AskMessage
This Message is used when the Server asks for the next move to a player.
AskType
This enumeration contains the values that represent what the Server may be asking for.
AssistantCard
The Assistant Cards are one of the key elements of the game.
AssistantCardMessage
This Message is used to communicate which Assistant Card has been chosen.
AssistantType
This enumeration specifies all the existent Assistant Card types.
Bard
Allows the player to switch from 0 to 2 students between the hall and the dining room.
BardPopupController
This popup controller is specifically designed for the Bard, and controls the popup.
Centaur
Allows the player to trigger a special version of the islandConquerCheck method, which does not count into the influence the towers' effect.
CharacterCard
The Character Cards are the notable addition to the Expert mode of a game.
CharacterCardAlreadyPlayedException
This exception is thrown if a player tries to play a Character Card in a round in which they have already played one.
CharacterCardMessage
This Message is used to communicate which parameter-less Character Card has been chosen.
CharacterCardMessageArrayListString
This Message is used to communicate which Character Card requesting an ArrayList parameter has been chosen, along with the given parameters.
CharacterCardMessageInt
This Message is used to communicate which Character Card requesting an int parameter has been chosen, along with the given parameters.
CharacterCardMessageString
This Message is used to communicate which Character Card requesting a String parameter has been chosen, along with the given parameters.
CharacterCardMessageStringInt
This Message is used to communicate which Character Card requesting a String and an int parameter has been chosen, along with the given parameters.
CharacterCardNotFoundException
This exception is thrown if a player tries to play a Character Card with an unknown ID (which means that the ID may be below 1 or over 12 or the card corresponding to that ID may not be currently present in the match).
Client
This class defines everything that a client should be able to do.
ClientController
This client-side class allows the client (by using a CLI or a GUI) to communicate with the server via the network.
ClientHandler
Interface to handle clients.
ClientMainCLI
This class contains a main method that allows a person to launch Eriantys via CLI.
ClientMainGUI
This class contains the main methods that allow the Eriantys application to launch via GUI, as well as basic attributes and useful fundamental methods.
Cloud
The cloud is one of the "physical" elements of the game.
CloudChoiceMessage
This Message is used to communicate which cloud has been chosen by a player at the end of their Action Phase.
Color
This enumeration specifies the existing colors for the game elements for which the color is a key factor.
ColorPopupController
This popup controller controls a popup that allows the player to choose a color between the ones existing in the game.
CommandLineInterface
This class offers a User Interface via terminal.
ConnectionSceneController
This scene controller handles the connection scene.
Constants
This class contains all the constants used in the game.
CreateGameMessage
This Message is used to communicate the parameters of the game the client wishes to create.
CreatingGameController
This scene controller handles the scene in which the client creates a game.
DisconnectionMessage
This Message is used to communicate to the connected players that a player has disconnected.
DoublyLinkedList
This is the islands' data structure.
EmptyBagException
This exception is thrown if the game controller runs out of students while trying to refill clouds or Character Cards.
EmptyCloudException
This exception is thrown if a players tries to empty a cloud that is already empty (in other words, if they try to choose a cloud already chosen in a certain round).
EndGameMessage
This Message is used to communicate to the players that the match they are playing has ended.
ErrorMessage
This Message is used to communicate a generic error to the clients.
Flagman
Allows the player to call the islandConquerCheck method on a selected island.
FullTableException
This exception is thrown if a player tries to move a student to a table, but the corresponding table has no spaces left.
Game
This class is the core of the game model, as it holds all the values that describe its status.
GameBoard
This class contains all the "physical" elements of the game.
GameBoardSceneController
This scene controller controls the Game Board scene, updating all of its contents everytime a player does something.
GameController
This server-side class controls the game flow of a game in Normal mode towards all of its phases, from its creation to the winner's declaration.
GameControllerExpertMode
This server-side class is the GameController's subclass, and offers new (overridden) methods to handle the game flow of a game in Expert mode.
GameControllerFactory
This class acts as a factory method for the game controller construction (it can be GameController or GameControllerExpertMode).
GameExpertMode
This class is the same as the Game class, but it handles Expert mode matches.
GamePhaseMessage
This Message is used to communicate to the client a change of phase during a match.
GameState
This enumeration contains the two possible states of a game (SETUP if the game controller is still accepting players, IN_GAME if the game has started).
GameStatusFirstActionPhaseMessage
This Message is used to communicate the current game status to the players.
GameStatusMessage
This Message is used to communicate the current game status to the players.
GenericMessage
This Message is used to communicate to the clients generic messages that need to be notified.
GenericSceneController
This interface is implemented by all the scene controllers, and is used to give a generic type to all of them.
GraphicalUserInterface
This class offers a User Interface via GUI.
Hall
The Hall is a third of the School.
Healer
Allows the player to put a veto tile on a chosen island: this means that if Mother Nature reaches an island with such a tile, no conquering check method will be called.
Innkeeper
Allows the player to call a special version of the profCheck method, which reassigns the professor even if the current player has the same amount of students of the same color of the current owner of the professor.
InputReadTask
This class is used to read the input stream and making the input kind of "interruptable".
IntCard
Defines a generic Character Card that needs an int as a parameter.
InvalidNumberOfStepsException
This exception is thrown if a player tries to make Mother Nature move of a number of steps they are not allowed to.
Island
The Island is one of the "physical" elements of the game.
IslandNotFoundException
This exception is thrown if a player provides an island ID that is not corresponding to any of the existing ones.
Jester
Allows the player to switch from 0 to 3 students between the hall and the students on the card.
JesterPopupController
This popup controller is specifically designed for the Jester, and controls the popup.
JoinGameMessage
This Message is used to communicate the ID of the game the client wishes to join.
JoiningGameController
This scene controller handles the scene in which the client joins an existing game.
Knight
Allows the player to call a special version of the islandConquerCheck method, which gives them an extra two points of influence.
LobbySceneController
This scene controller handles the scene in which the client chooses whether to create a new game or to join an existing one.
LoginRequest
This Message is used to communicate to the server the nickname chosen by the client, in order to enter the lobby.
Message
This abstract class defines everything that a message surfing the network should have.
MessageType
This enumeration contains all the message types available and used by the server and clients.
Monk
Allows the player to move a specified student from the card to a specified island.
MotherNatureStepsMessage
This Message is used to communicate how many steps the player wishes Mother Nature to move of.
MoveToIslandMessage
This Message is used to communicate which student the player wishes to move to which island.
MoveToTableMessage
This Message is used to communicate which student the player wishes to move to its table.
NicknameSceneController
This scene controller handles the scene in which the client chooses their nickname.
NonExistentColorException
This exception is thrown if a player manages to provide a table color that is not present in the game.
NotEnoughCoinsException
This exception is thrown if a player tries to play a Character Card, but they don't afford it.
NoVetoTilesException
This exception is thrown if a player tries to use the Healer Character Card, but the game board has no more veto tiles available.
Observable
This abstract class defines everything that an observable class should allow.
Observer
This interface defines everything that an observer class should allow.
Player
This class is the representation of a playing client in the game model.
PlayerNumberMessage
This Message is used to communicate how many players a newborn game should have.
PopupController
This abstract class defines everything that a popup controller should allow.
Postman
Allows the player to move Mother Nature of up to two more spaces than of the ones specified by the Assistant Card played.
Princess
Allows the player to move a specified student from the card to the appropriate table.
SceneController
This controller allows all the scenes, and the associated controllers, to change properly.
School
The school is one of the "physical" elements of the game.
Server
Main server class that starts a socket server.
ServerMain
This class contains a main method that launches the Eriantys' server, so that clients can connect to it and play the game.
ShowDeckMessage
This Message is used to communicate to the client the player's Assistant Card deck, so that it is correctly shown.
ShowExistingGamesMessage
This Message is used to communicate to the clients the games currently present on the server.
SocketClient
The implementation of the Client abstract class.
SocketClientHandler
ClientHandler implementation that handles the communication between a Client and the Server.
SocketServer
This class implements the socket on the computer's local address and on a specified port.
StringCard
Defines a generic Character Card that needs a String as a parameter.
StringIntCard
Defines a generic Character Card that needs a String and an int as parameters.
Student
The students are the "passive" protagonists of the game.
StudentNotFoundException
This exception is thrown if a player tries to move a student that is not where stated.
StudentsCard
Defines a generic Character Card that has students on itself.
StudentsPopupController
This popup controller controls a popup that allows the player to choose a student between the ones present on the selected card.
Table
The table is a part of the dining room, which is a third of a School.
Thief
Once given a (existing) color, the game steals from every player 3 students of that color, and puts them back into the students' bag.
TieException
This exception is thrown in the rare case a game ends in perfect tie (specifically, two or more players share the same amount of towers left and the same amount of professors owned at the same time).
TowerColor
This enumeration contains all the values representing the tower colors currently existing in the game.
TowerRoom
The tower room is a third of a School.
TryAgainException
This exception is the super-class of every custom exception (except TieException).
UpdateMessage
This Message is used to communicate to the players who are waiting for their turn the actions done by the current player.
View
This interface defines a generic view to be implemented by each view type (e.g.
ViewObservable
his abstract class defines everything that an observable view should allow.
ViewObserver
Custom observer interface for views.
Villager
Allows the player to call a special version of the islandConquerCheck method, which allows them to take a chosen color out of the regular influence algorithm.
VirtualView
This class hides the network implementation from the controller.
Wizard
This enumeration specifies the existing wizard IDs.
WizardIDMessage
This Message is used to communicate to the server the ID of the wizard chosen by the client.
WizardSceneController
This scene controller handles the scene in which the client chooses a wizard before starting a game.
WrongMessageSentException
This exception is thrown if the message received from a client is not of one of the types expected by the controller (or by the server).
WrongTurnException
This exception is thrown if a client manages to send the server (and consequently the controller) a message of an expected type, but not during the game round they are allowed to.
